wordpressPost.title: How to find a good cosmetic surgeon
wordpressPost.content:
How to find a good cosmetic surgeon

Finding a good cosmetic surgeon is not as easy as one may think.

Sure you can search the internet and find cosmetic surgeons and, you’ll get a long list of doctors but, how do you know if they’re any good and, how do you know about their past mistakes?

The truth is, many of the lists that are online are paid ads.  The reviews are usually the good ones, and the good ones are most commonly promoted by yet again, paid ads.
If a doctor has made mistakes and they get a bad review, these reviews are usually pushed so far down that you typically don’t see them.
Are there excellent cosmetic surgeons that you can find online?  Of course, there are but, how do you know?
The answer is, you don’t know who will be operating on you from an internet search or another type of ad.  So, it’s up to you to do enough research to feel as sure as you possibly can before going under the knife.

How to find a good cosmetic surgeon

The best ways to find a good plastic surgeon is:
  • Get a referral from someone that you know who has had good results.
  • Make sure the doctor is board certified.
  • For me, I want someone who has been practicing for at least ten years.  Experience matters.
  • Go for a consultation and trust your gut!
  • Do a Google search and go past the first few pages to look deep.
  • Go to https://www.abplasticsurgery.org/public/verify-certification/ModDefault.aspx?section=SurgeonSearch   to check and see if the doctor that you are considering is board certified and has no complaints or alerts.
  • You can also go here http://www.fsmb.org/policy/contactst to see if the doctor has any licensing complaints
  • Try and pick someone who specializes in the type of procedure that you want.  The face and the body are very different and I think it takes a skilled hand to be able to work on a face.
  • Ask where they perform surgery, and find out that facility’s level of accreditation. Look for AAAASF, AAAHC or JCAHO operating facility certification.
  • “Ask about the anesthetist’s qualifications. For safety, you want either a Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA) or a Board Certified Anesthesiologist administering your anesthesia. (http://www.americanboardcosmeticsurgery.org/patient-resources/choosing-a-cosmetic-surgeon
  • I always check to see how friendly and how happy the staff are.  If they are not happy then, to me, it raises questions in my mind.
  • Never get cosmetic surgery based on the price.  Procedures are different but the knife is a whole other story.

 

The key to getting good results after you have researched your doctor is to be in good health, expect realistic results and, to maintain the results afterwards.

These are only some of the ways to find a good cosmetic surgeon.  Please do your due diligence when it comes to finding a good plastic surgeon.
